title: Remove outlier images extracted in Colab ....because they have no dots to refine

labels.name: howtousedlc
labels.description: issue regarding the use of DeepLabCut

body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Bug description

I extracted outlier images from analyzed videos in Colab before realizing that doing so in Colab would result in errors - the images extracted in Colab have no labels on them to refine. I thought I could extract the images in Colab (as it would be faster with a GPU) and then refine the labels on my CPU, but the images didn't extract correctly. I would like to simply delete the outlier frames and their corresponding rows from the machine-labels h5 and machine-labels csv files, however I’m not sure what function to use to do this. Simply deleting the extra images and then running the function deeplabcut.dropannotationfileentriesduetodeletedimages(config) does not work in this case…Is there an alternate function I could use? Thanks!!

### Operating System

Windows/Google Colab

### DeepLabCut version

dlc version 2.2.1 on colab
dlc version 2.2.0.6 on windows

### DeepLabCut mode

single animal

### Device type

gpu google for outlier image extraction
cpu on windows when I ran the refine labels function

### Steps To Reproduce

1. Windows code:
(base) C:\Users\kkmgo>activate DEEPLABCUT

(DEEPLABCUT) C:\Users\kkmgo>ipython
Python 3.8.12 | packaged by conda-forge | (default, Oct 12 2021, 21:22:46) [MSC v.1916 64 bit (AMD64)]
Type 'copyright', 'credits' or 'license' for more information
IPython 8.1.1 -- An enhanced Interactive Python. Type '?' for help.

2022-05-25 08:31:29.363636: W tensorflow/stream_executor/platform/default/dso_loader.cc:64] Could not load dynamic library 'cudart64_110.dll'; dlerror: cudart64_110.dll not found
2022-05-25 08:31:29.364225: I tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cudart_stub.cc:29] Ignore above cudart dlerror if you do not have a GPU set up on your machine.

In [2]: deeplabcut.__version__
Out[2]: '2.2.0.6'

In [3]: config_path='C:/Users/kkmgo/Dropbox/Turtle_Dance-Kayla-2022-01-26/config.yaml'

In [4]: deepla

bcut.refine_labels(config_path) #attached photo of the images brought up in the GUI

    # Cropping Parameters (for analysis and outlier frame detection)
